Qualifiers.Applicability: Procedure to determine if a porch is at least 50% open (using Figure 5 as an example)

SegmentClassification.description: Each perimeter segment to be classified as 'open' or 'closed' for comparison

Procedure.description: Determine the perimeter of the porch and divide it into segments that will allow a comparison of closed and open segments.

Mandatory: Complete Step 1 to enable comparison of closed and open segments for openness determination.
Conditional: Comparison of closed and open segments requires classification criteria for 'open' vs 'closed' segments, which are not included on this page.
Ambiguities: Criteria for classifying segments as 'open' or 'closed' are not defined on this page.
The phrase 'at least 50% open' is referenced without an explicit formula; Step 1 implies perimeter-based measurement but this is not explicitly stated.

Hierarchical: This is Step 1 within a multi-step method for evaluating the 50% openness criterion.
CrossReferences: Figure 5: Roofed 1st floor porch (example referenced for measurements and segmentation)
LogicalDependencies: Total perimeter must be established before comparing lengths of open vs closed segments.
Equations: perimeter_total = sum(lengths of segments A through G)
ConsistencyFindings: Sum of segments A (2 ft) + B (8 ft) + C (10 ft) + D (7 ft) + E (14 ft) + F (24 ft) + G (2 ft) = 67 ft, which does not match the reported perimeter total of 70 ft.
